document.topic_text: JHB set for DA mayor It appears that the Democratic Alliance and the Economic Freedom Fighters have come to an agreement in Johannesburg. Shortly DA mayoral candidate Herman Mashaba is expected to be elected mayor of Johannesburg 22 August 2016 – The scene is set for the Democratic Alliance mayoral candidate in Johannesburg Herman Mashaba to receive the chain of office. While the EFF leader Julius Malema expressed concerns about Mashaba after the 3 August elections, it now appears that the two parties – the DA and EFF – have agreed to work together to remove the ANC administration in the city. The vote is expected to take place within the next hour. Although the ANC won the most votes in the city, it was not an overall majority. The opposition parties collectively polled an overall majority together. Herman Mashaba Interviewed by eNCA prior to his expected election this morning – Monday morning – he said he expected to put together a professional public service in Johannesburg. Asked if he was confident of being elected, Mashaba – speaking in the Johannesburg council chamber – said the EFF and the DA had agreed on forming “this coalition… so that we get the ANC out… so we form a government”. He said people of Zandspruit and Soweto, who had been ignored by the ANC government, would be looked after in future. “The voters have spoken… they need a new administration,” Mashaba said.
